messages.rules: When working with the service, it is mandatory: 1. It is forbidden to share configurations (QR codes for smartphones or *.conf files for PCs) with other people. One configuration can only be used for one of your devices. At the same time, you can request an unlimited number of additional configurations for your use. 2. It is forbidden to download files via torrent clients. However, the *.torrent extension files themselves can be downloaded. Example: You want to download the movie, but the website hosting the files is not available from Russia. You turn on the VPN, go to the website and download the filmexample.torrent file. Next, you turn off the VPN and start downloading the movie itself in your torrent client. When working with the service, it is recommended: 1. Do not use a VPN at times when you do not need it. Thanks to this, you will not experience problems with your applications.

messages.sql_insert_config_info: Send me a message in the format (spaces are used instead of line breaks): client_id - client_username | client_telegram_id protocol_id - w (WireGuard) | x (XTLS-Reality) | s (ShadowSocks) location_id - n (Netherlands) | l (Latvia) | g (Germany) | u (USA) os - Android | IOS | Windows | Linux date_of_receipt - date of receipt of the configuration in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH-MI link - if instead of a photo or a *.conf file, you need a link for XTLS/SS for PC Do not forget to attach the file if required!
messages.sql_insert_config_check_config_info: By the way, you can check which configurations are available to the client with the command /check_configs telegram_id | username
